item.title: The Timber
item.description: Year 1889. In ice Alaska, during a gold-rush, brothers Samuel and Wyatt go to a dangerous travel. To keep honor of the house, they have to find the tiranichny father who many years ago left them. Ahead they have a heap of troubles with cruel bandits. Gloomy scenes and crude climate grow dim before greed, thirst of the power and death which they face.

item.title: Slow West
item.description:
History of the adventurer by the name of Silas accompanying on a dangerous travel along all American border of the 16-year-old fellow by the name of Jay Cavendish. Jay searches for the girl with whom he is in love.

They were crossed accidentally, the lonely wolf who became separated from pack of wolves and the hare who appeared in a wolf den. He could allow it to die, could kill, but did not seize a throat, and went with it on a trace, helping to find the love which hid somewhere, seeing off through fields of hatred and the wood of fear, firmly, without having decided what to do next with it and with itself.

item.title: Jane Got a Gun
item.description: McCann's bandits pursue Ham who tried to beat off gang. Honeycombed by bullets, he takes cover on the ranch of the beauty wife Jane. She should address for protection the one whom she would like to see least of all — to the former lover. Jane needs to forget the past, to master feelings and to become strong and uncompromising to save family from punishment of gang of mercenaries.

item.title: The Ridiculous 6

item.title: The Revenant
item.description: The hunter Hugh Glass is seriously wounded on novel open spaces of the American Wild West. Companion Hugh on group of subjugators of new lands John Fitszherald foully leaves it to die alone. Now Glass had only one weapon — his will power. He is ready to throw down a challenge to the primitive nature, severe winter and hostile tribes of Indians, only to survive and revenge Fitszherald.

item.title: Hell or High Water
item.description: The young guy Toby and his elder brother Tanner who recently went out of prison learn that the huge credit hung on their died mother. And now, if not to repay the debt in a certain time, the bank will appropriate the family ranch. Trying to find the necessary sum in so short time, Toby persuades the brother to take incredibly risky step – to rob several small banks. Having armed and having put on mask faces, brothers go to a dangerous tour on local financial institutions, without suspecting at all where this mad idea can bring them.
